rows.STUDIO LEVEL — FULL MODEL MAP (S0-S40): The studio needs the same sophistication as the business. Here's every model it needs.
S1 (Production), S2 (Labor), S3 (Infrastructure) already exist with content tabs.
They need to be EXPANDED, not replaced. And 37+ new models need to be created.
Every S- model gets the same structural tabs: P- (Project Plan), C- (Contract), IP- (Industry), V- (Verification).
Below is the full map. Existing models marked with ★.

rows.col_3: What It Covers
Why this studio exists. The coordination hedgefund thesis. What we believe. What we're building. Kill criteria for the studio itself.
How Trades get produced. AI loop. Expert calibration. Quality standards. The 5-step production process.
Roles, recruiting funnels, career boosters, contracts, the MC, the admin, onboarding UX. Full labor system.
Two-company structure. DAO. Entity. Cap table. Fundraising for the infrastructure company.
What a Trade IS. How models relate. Tab dependencies. The map of maps. Grand unifying dictionary. Symbol grounding.
How decisions get made at studio level. Compliance Manager for the studio. Grading of Trades. Quality gates.
The Dan Crowley funnel for every role. Cold email. Platforms. Advertorial engine. Fernando Oliver swipe files. Pass-the-bottom recruiting.
The MC role in full. Conversation scheduling. Production specs. Equipment. Training. Content management.
The series producer role. Narrative arcs. Episode planning. Cast management. Story bible. Production quality standards.
How we find, engage, and retain domain experts. Expert profiles. Compensation. Review process. Grading rubric.
How cluster PMs are recruited, onboarded, managed, and evaluated. Scorecard. Competence framework. Equity structure.
The full journey from first touch to cast page. Every touchpoint designed. Onboarding. Offboarding. Alumni network.
How every role is a career booster. Portfolio artifacts. Network value. Skills demonstrated. The pitch per role.
What the studio believes. How people treat each other. Communication norms. Conflict resolution. What we don't tolerate.
How clusters work. Formation. PM assignment. Expert pairing. Milestone tracking. Cross-cluster dependencies.
The system for turning models into lead magnets. Fernando Oliver model. Extract → Package → Gate → Distribute → Sequence → Convert.
Economics of the studio. Cost per Trade. Revenue per business launched. Portfolio modeling. Fund economics.
Holding company structure. IP licensing. Portfolio company relationships. Studio cap table. Inter-entity agreements.
Tools used to produce Trades. Claude configuration. Spreadsheet infrastructure. CMS. Video hosting. Collaboration tools.
How the studio captures, organizes, and retrieves knowledge across Trades. The library. Search. Cross-referencing.
Metrics for the studio itself. Trades produced. Models verified. People recruited. Businesses launched. Portfolio performance.
What content the studio produces. YouTube. Twitter. LinkedIn. Podcasts. Newsletters. Which channels. What cadence.
The password-protected site. Design. UX. Video hosting. Cast page. Daily updates. CMS requirements.
How participants stay connected. Alumni network. Slack/Discord. Events. The network effect of having worked in the system.
What businesses the studio launches and why. Selection criteria. Market sizing. Thesis for each business type.
How new businesses get selected. Evaluation framework. Kill criteria. Go/no-go decisions. Pipeline management.
How CoS/operators get matched to businesses. Scorecard. Cultural fit. Domain fit. Incentive alignment.
How the studio tracks performance of launched businesses. Dashboards. CM grading. Intervention triggers.
How learnings from one business improve others. Shared services. Shared experts. Shared infrastructure.
The raise for the infrastructure company. Deck. Data room. Investor targets. Timeline. Terms.
How we communicate with studio investors. Updates. Reporting. Board management. Transparency.
Other venture studios. How they work. Where we're different. Rocket Internet. Pioneer Square. Atomic. Idealab.
The school model applied to the studio. How operators learn. Semesters. Graduation. Curriculum.
The theoretical foundations. Complexity at launch. Requisite variety. Coordination debt. The intellectual framework.
Bohm, Alexander, Tononi, Ashby. How deep theory generates operational improvements.
How Trades become published references. Editing process. Design. Distribution. ISBN. The textbook business.
How Trades become software. Product requirements. AI integration. User experience. The SaaS business.
What happens at 10 businesses. At 50. At 500. Organizational design at scale. The network effects.
What can go wrong. Scenario planning. Insurance. Business continuity. What if Nilo dies.
Daily, weekly, monthly cadence for the studio. Standups. Reviews. Planning. Retrospectives.
The studio-level navigation. Where does a new studio participant start? How do they orient?
